summary: Gears cancel - needs to complete last chunk before allowing a new upload
description:
I did note however a 'shoot in the foot' thing when canceling the upload (which was also there before the tmpfile changes I guess) and is most noticable when using larger chunksizes (i.e. 10MB as on my testbox).

When I cancel an upload the UI tells me 'Cancelled upload but in the background Gears is still uploading the last started chunk. With a slow uplink and large chunk sizes that can take a while. On the server this last chunk (still in transit) is not yet appended to the tmpfile so when I resume the upload while gears is still uploading the chunk from the previous attempt that could lead to chunks being sent and appended twice.

The scenario would be in that case that while the previous chunk is still in transit Flex asks for the already uploaded filesize *before* the chunk in transit is appended to the tmpfile on the server. That chunk will thus be sent again but since the one still in transit is also appended to the tmpfile the file on the server will get the chunk twice.

Would it be possible to have the 'Cancel upload' function either wait for Gears to actually finish the chunk being uploaded or have Flex somehow 'kill' the Gears-upload ?

summary: Flash upload - clean up correctly on cancel upload.
PHP session timeout with large (long) flash uploads
description:
When a Flash upload (no gears) takes a long time (for example from a residential ADSL link) the upload can take longer than the PHP session expiry timer (default on debian is 1440 seconds is 24 minutes). During the upload the session-cache file is removed on the server but the upload continues (it started when the session was still valid). After the upload processing the file fails due to the expired session. Also cancelling the upload after the session has expired on the server gives an error:

Error: [256] Invalid session supplied. : /var/www/filesender-0.1.17.201010290059/www/fs_uploadit.php [47] 

We could configure a higher value for the session.gc_maxlifetime setting but there are good reasons to keep that value low. Another solution could be to to send some kind of 'keepalive' every now and then from the client to the server during the upload to keep the session 'active'. Note that setting client_specific_logging to true will keep the session active on the server so something similar but less verbose  would probably work.

summary: UTF 8 charachters in name deleted by CRON
description:
On 25.10.2010. 8:55, Nikola Garafolic wrote:
> How can file get status "Closed" other than user deleting it or 
> reaching expiry date?
> I have some files that have not expired, and users swear they did not 
> delete them, but are in "Closed" status, and physically not present 
> inside filesender files directory. I am refering to version 1.16.1.

I believe we found the reason for this behavior.

In case when filename contains UTF-8 characters field "fileoriginalname" 
in the database will be different from the name of file stored on the disc. Because of the discrepancy function cleanUp in cron.php will assume that the file was removed and it will put the file status to Closed. This will be performed in the last loop ("// close all entries that do not have a pyhsical file in storage"). File will not be removed immediately but at the next cron.php run (loop "// Loop through the files").

The reason for discrepancy is the following. Field "fileoriginalname" 
comes from the JSON feed sent by Flash and the actual name comes from the _FILES variable. In case of JSON feed UTF-8 chars will be changed to \uxxxx equivalents by the json_encode. In case of _FILES variable they will simply be turned to "_" by the sanitizeFilename function.

I attached a patch for fs_uploadit.php which turns UTF-8 name from _FILES variable to JSON feed equivalent.

Cheers,
emir

summary: Max Upload Size consistency
description:
Some notes about the actual flash upload limits, independent of the exclamation mark problem but relevant to testing filesizes around 2000M.

Upload of 2000M (base 1024) file of 2097152000 bytes, upload from a Win7 box with Opera, no gears

At the start of the upload I get on the server:

Oct 29 12:43:33 apache2[11765]: PHP Warning: POST Content-Length of 2097152672 bytes exceeds the limit of 2097152000 bytes in Unknown on line 0

simplesamlphp[11765]: Error: [8] Undefined index: Filedata : /usr/share/filesender/www/fs_uploadit.php [62]
apache2[11765]: Error: [8] Undefined index: fid : /usr/share/filesender/www/fs_uploadit.php [62]
apache2[11765]: Error: [8] Undefined index: Filedata : /usr/share/filesender/www/fs_uploadit.php [62]

After upload the client gets a 'Can not move file' error. It looks like there is no 'tmp' file created on the server. Also note that the Content-Length is 672 bytes larger than the actual filesize of 2097152000. It would be good to catch this error at the start of the upload so users don't have to wait a possibly long time to see that the upload failed.

The advertised limit is 2000M (the post_max_size=2000M limit in PHP.ini):
; Maximum size of POST data that PHP will accept.
post_max_size = 2000M

Setting post_max_size=2001 (and a restart of apache!) makes it possible to upload a 2000M file. This should be in the installation notes (setting post_max_size a little bit larger than the upload_max_filesize to allow for extra header info which is included in the POST Content-Length.

As for the maximum filesize with Flash there are two other relevant variables:

In php.ini:

; Maximum allowed size for uploaded files.
upload_max_filesize = 2000M
i
and in the filesender config.php:

$config['max_flash_upload_size'] = '2147483648'; // 2GB

These should match (but don't in the default config) so the user will be warned when uploading more than the the minimum of the two settings. We could explain this in the installation notes or perhaps it is possible to add a check on the (three!) relevant variables and only allow uploads that are less than or equal to the minimum of the three settings (taking into account that the post_max_size should allow for some extra bytes, say a few K).

Either way, the current defaults and installation notes are not consistent and will give problems with flash uploads around and above the 2000M (base 1024).

summary: UTF-8 in message/subject/selected file field triggers failure after file upload
description:
Symptoms:

-user uploads file
-user gets "Your file has been sent"
-file is written on disk at server side
-empty database object is put in database
-user does NOT receive any emails
-file does NOT appear in MyFiles
-the Administrator view shows an empty line

From a user's point of view the upload failed silently.  

It turns out we can reproduce this bug by putting UTF8 characters (øæå etc.) in at least the message field.  

We need to test the various cases where people could use non-ASCII characters:

- selected filename
- message subject
- message text

and those for both flash and gears upload *and* subsequent download (the download of a gears uploaded file currently fails with invalid voucher).

As part of the bug fix we need to implement a check that lets a "bad" or "empty" database insert fail loudly so that we can give the user a "hard error".

summary: download blocks other filesender operations in the same session/browser
description:
When using 'session_start()' (r372/r251) in download.php a user can only download *one* file at a time with the same browser. This is probably because PHP only allows one script active at a time on a session. This can be an issue when a user downloads a large file taking a long time and also wants to download other files (with the same browser). 

This also affects other filesender operations, for example when a user is downloading a large file he/she cannot login or do other authenticated actions because the download script is 'blocking' the session.

How to repeat: start a download of a large file taking a long time. Then try (while the file is downloading) with the same browser to do other actions with filesender (on the same server). They will give you blank screens *until* the download is finished or cancelled.

A solution might be to have download.php to have its own 'session id' for each download. Not sure about the possibilities and/or implications though :(

summary: email address validation in flex
description:
Date: Tue, 30 Nov 2010 12:38:54 +0100
From: Nikola Garafolic <nikola.garafolic@srce.hr>
Reply-To: filesender-dev@filesender.org
To: filesender-dev@filesender.org
Subject: [filesender-dev] email validation in flex

Hi,

Is is possible to implement some sort of email address validation? Users input all kind of bad
email address syntax like:

'my.email@domain.com'
"my.email@domain.com"
name surname <my.email@domain.com>
<my.email@domain.com>

Filesender expects email address in the my.email@domain.com form, so all of the above are
undeliverable email addresses.

Some sort of regex check like this should be enough:

\b[A-Z0-9._%-]+@[A-Z0-9.-]+\.[A-Z]{2,4}\b

Regards,
Nikola

Even if we indicate that the max. expiry time is one month in the future, a user can simply set the date of his machine into the future and there you go, your file will stay online longer. summary: Filename with international characters other than ISO-8859-1 will look 'funny' when downloaded with IE
description:
When using international characters in filenames other than ISO-8859-1 the filename will look 'funny' when downloaded with Internet Explorer and possibly other browsers other than FireFox, Chrome or Safari. The file is however correctly downloaded and usable.  

The "Content-Dispositon" problem

At the moment the labeling of a string as UTF-8 encoded is not done when a file containing special characters is downloaded. The download process uses the HTTP Content-Disposition header with a filename parameter. This header is only defined for filenames containing characters from the (single byte) ISO-8859-1 character set.

Although there are currently ongoing standardisation efforts to make it possible to use other character sets there is no universally adopted way of transmitting a UTF-8 encoded filename yet (see http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/draft-ietf-httpbis-content-disp-latest.html for details). The current filesender code therefore relies on what is called 'encoding sniffing' in browsers such as FireFox, Chrome and Safari. Internet Explorer can only handle ISO-8859-1 (single byte) encoded filenames.

See our developer documentation on International_Character_Handling

Wendy has confirmed this on apps3 and AARNet's current (patched) variant of 1.0. Xander has also confirmed on 1.0 and trunk.

summary: Quota support [M]
description:
The goal of quota support is to be able to restrict how many resources a user uses.

Option 1: cumulative upload-size limit: a maximum to the total size of active files a user has on a FileSender install 
Option 2: time-relative upload-size limit per user: a user can only upload a certain amount of data in a certain time frame
Option 3: max. number of uploads in a certain time period

Option (3) sounds illogical: the resource consumed is the amount of disk, not the amount of network sockets.  Option (1) might be the most logical one as it offers a user some form of control: if they go over their quota, they can encourage the downloader to download quickly so they get free upload slots again.

It ought to be a system-wide setting, one size fits all.  User-specific settings we have no way to maintain, so those need to come out of the authentication source.

summary: Get list of FileSender "release candidate test" sites
description:
The software lifecycle specs state that when we release a FileSender code package as a release candidate, it has to run on at least two sites -with a useful number of users- without error for at least 1 week before said release candidate is re-branded as a release.  We need a list of sites willing to run release candidate code.

BTW, we *also* need a list of beta-test sites.  Sites willing to set up and maintain beta test installs that have a useful user base.

summary: Gears fileSize limits can be circumvented

n upload_gears.mxml there are a few checks on filesize (and other stuff
that's not allowed):

1) fileSize = 0
2) os - Mac and fileSize > 2G
3) fileSize > max_gears_upload_size

In all these cases the user gets the pop up just after selecting the fie
(good) *but* in all these cases the selected file is put in the UI and
the SEND button appears. So even after the warning (too large) a user
still can upload the 'illegal' file by pressing SEND.

The fun part is that this is only when using gears. In the
upload_std.mxml (flash upload) everything is OK, the user gets the popup
warning, the file-part in the UI is cleared and there is *NO* SEND
button to press.

There is some code in upload_gears.mxml that looks like it should
prevent the SEND button appearing after a warning but that doesn't seem
to do the job.

Please select another file." This was with Gears, on Mac OSX 10.6.7, FF 3.6.16, Flash 10.2.152.33.

summary: Logout warning about still existing 'IdP sessions'
description:
The SURFnet Office IdP replaces the normal SP logout page with a strong security advice when logging out of a service like FileSender. This should warn users that logging out of one specific service doesn't terminate other sessions one might have to other services and also doesn't clear the 'main' session with the identity provider of the user. This makes it possible to login again to FileSender without being asked for credentials. We might want to add a warning about this to the FileSender logout page.

The (a bit technical) text from the SURFet IdP as example:
-------------
Due to the nature of this centralized authentication infrastructure and the type of sessions that you have running, it not possible to terminate all of your sessions with each Service Provider with 100% certainty. There is only one option for guaranteed secure logout:

Shutdown your browser when you want to end your running sessions in a secure way!

Apologies for the inconvenience: this is a strong security advice.
-------------

Suggestion from Wendy: "Your logout from FileSender is complete. To ensure you have also been logged out from  your institutional identity provider, please quit your browser."

Possible bears on the road:
- does this cover all cases ? (is every logon to FileSender 'federative'? How about a local u/p database setup?

summary: Allow uploader to disable download receipt email to file *recipient*
description:
The concrete use case that triggered this is when someone sends a large file to a mailing list.  The receipt email "person X has downloaded file Y" is sent *to* the uploader with a Cc: to the *downloader/recipient*.  If the recipient is an email list, the Cc: will go to the email list for every download.  If you distribute a file to a list with several 100 people, that is a bit .. annoying.

The difficulty here is to cater for use cases like this without complicating the user interface.  A solution might be to have different "filesender user views" depending on which "persona" you are.  Using personas is a common technique in user interaction design.  You define a limited number of persons with certain characteristics as the people you imagine will use the software and cater to their needs.  

For FileSender this might be: a first time user, someone who uses the functionality "as is" and someone who considers him/herself as a "power user" and wants to be able to tweak more of the experience.  The first time user would for example have access to a more "guided" approach, a "as is" user knows how to use FileSender but needs no advanced functionality nor does he want to be bothered with the "guided use".   The power user would have the option to switch stuff on and off.

This would lead to 3 views on the functionality.  

I am tempted to think we need to go that way, as we also need to figure out how to incorporate for example time stamping in the UI.

This requires more thought and more speccing, but at least it is a ticket now....

summary: Enable expiry time extension
description:
Yesterday I presented CloudStor to about 40 faculty-IT support at NTNU, Trondheim Uni.  One of them came with the question whether it was possible, in MyFiles, to extend the expiry time of a file.  Say you sent a file to someone, that someone turned out to be on holiday, then you might want to extend the expiry time.

Thoughts: treat this in the way libraries do?  Allow for one (or more, such to be configurable) extension of the expiry date, presumably using a button "extend file availability period".  Easiest would be if you would have a standard "file availability extension" period.  That would be server-configurable as well, and presumably one week would be a good default.  However, you can see coming that people would want to just pick a particular date: "I *know* the person will be back on that and that date, so that date + 1 week is good."

This then implies both a button "extend" which does a standard extension plus a calendar which allows a user to set a more specific date.  The date box would need to be there anyway to show when the file is about to expire.  Having said that, there still ought to be a max expire, also on "extension of availability".  By far the easiest way to get started with this appears to be a simple button "extend availability" that simply extends availability with a configurable standard amount of time/days and not let the user pick something.

summary: Multiple User Interface views, guided use vs. normal use
description:
Some users have "computer fear".  So while the FileSender UI is very self-explaining, some users need a little bit of assistance in first time use to allow them to overcome "first use fear".  

What I imagine is that a first time user can have some "first use assistance" in the form of for example a little youtube video showing them how FileSender works (in their own language), and possibly a big help button.  Something like that.  

But this is UI clutter for those people who know quite well how to use it.  So hence this ticket: I would like to make it possible that a first time user gets a slightly different UI experience then a second time user.  This mechanism can be generalised to offer different groups different "help".

Error in apache.conf included with debian package
description:
The second part of "Alias /filesender /usr/share/filesender/www", */usr/share/filesender/www*, must be identical to the path in <Directory> or you get a *403 permision denied* when visiting the webpage and   the following error *Log: Directory index forbidden by Options directive: /usr/share/filesender/www* in the apache log.

Furthermore, they both ought to end with *www/* (notice the slash) as if not you get the error *File does not exist: /usr/share/filesender/wwwfilesender* when accessing *http://<domain>/filesender*

Thought: i am not sure whether this message should link to a page on our assembla site, or whether it should link to a page in the filesender install. summary: Self-signed certificates problems vs official documentation
description:
Hi,

I would like to strongly suggest to change the official installation [1] manuals to NOT include generating of a self-signed certificate since Flash only works with self-signed certificates in Internet Explorer and results in famous Flash 2038 IO Error when trying to upload a file using all non-IE browsers (both Linux and Windows). It seems to be a Flash issue [2], but it is rather hard to figure it out from very generic "#2038 IO Error" message code.
I know that the instructions say: "Be sure to get a real certificate since filesender won't work with snakeoil certificates." but if  these steps are not valid and must be replaced (with fairly different steps), why to include them in the first place?

We have spent a considerable amount of time to track this down so it maybe worth to include the "2038 error" in the related FAQ [3] for people getting the error not realizing it works with http.

Cheers
Jiri Horky

[1] http://www.assembla.com/spaces/file_sender/wiki/Installation_-_Debian_Ubuntu
[2] http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/FP-201
[3] http://www.assembla.com/wiki/show/file_sender/FAQ#71202d207369746520776f726b732077697468206874747020627574206e6f7420776974682068747470732c20756e636c656172206572726f72732e

summary: Minor re-order of AuP, "select file" and "upload" + suggested name change

2. I suggest to rename the "upload" button to "Send", make it *big* and reposition it.  Right now it sits right next to the "Browse" button.  However, the steps a user has to take go from top to bottom.  To me it makes more sense to have the "Send" button as the last thing to do in a flow that goes from top to bottom.  It needs to big to make sure a user doesn't have to use more effort then needed to both see the button and click on it.

3. Right now, you have a label "select a file", followed by a text box followed by a browse button.  Upon selecting a file, the name and size are displayed underneath that textbox.  It would make more sense to start with a label "Selected file" followed by an empty field followed by a "Select a file" or "Browse for a file" button.  The name would then appear in the empty field, the size underneath, and -if possible- the date the file was last changed if that is an attribute that can be asked for.  The text boxes should be un-editable.

summary: Investigate whole testing chain with Saucelabs for 1 feature and report
description:
We need to know what it would mean to use a "test platform as a service" like Sauce Labs.  Sauce Labs offers selenium based testing as a service.  For open source projects the service can be used for free.

If such a service could work for us it presumably gives us:
- an opportunity to scale testing to many more browsers without incurring an increase in time use
- an opportunity to let anyone run tests once tests have been defined.  This opens up for including running defined end user workflow tests in the development of new features /fixing of bugs: development is ready once the existing tests succeed

https://saucelabs.com/resources

Create a test account at Sauce Labs, take one feature from FileSender 2.0, for example the "drag and drop file selection" feature, and try to create a Sauce Labs test for this.  From their feature list they should have PHP bindings, I would think it would be most convenient for the FileSender project to define its Selenium-server tests in PHP.  The Sauce Labs web site has plenty of documentation to get you started :)  Sauce Labs allows to import Selenium IDE scripts, which may be useful.  Would be convenient to know if there is an effort difference between importing IDE created scripts and writing tests in code.

You can test against https://terasender.uninett.no/branches/filesender-2.0/ until further notice.  Login using an OpenIdP account, self-registration should still be possible (OpenIdP is being phased out).

What I'm after is a first impression of using Sauce Labs for practical testing.

summary: In Assembla Tickets: Add "Fixed In" column in tickets to deal with 1.0 bugs fixed in 1.5
description:
We have a number of issues that are labeled "known defficiency in 1.0" that we promised we'd fix in a next version.  Most of them will be dealt with, in some way, in FileSender 1.5.  To ensure a proper documentation-trail for those issues, we need a way to indicate they *are* fixed in version 1.5, but for those sites using 1.0 they are still an issue.

Thus, we can not *close* them as being bugs, but from a 1.5 (and future) point of view they are no longer a problem.  This is part of well-defined and smooth software lifecycle management that serves to give sites running FileSender predictability.

Suggestion is to add a "Fixed in" field to our Assembla tickets.  That way we can indicate in 1.0 bugs in which version they were fixed.  That ought to solve the problem Good Enough.

0: /usr/share/simplesamlphp/lib/SimpleSAML/Auth/State.php:158 (SimpleSAML_Auth_State::loadState)
1: /usr/share/simplesamlphp/modules/saml/www/sp/saml2-acs.php:24 (require)
2: /usr/share/simplesamlphp/www/module.php:135 (N/A)

URL:
https://filesender.surfnet.nl/simplesaml/module.php/saml/sp/saml2-acs.php/default-sp
This is a common case when using SSP (not only with FileSender) and I'm not sure if it is fixable or where it should be 'fixed'. A few posibilities to handle this: - Disable the Back button (if possible but even when it is possible it looks intrusive/confusing to do that) - Leave it as is and make a FAQ entry - Do a 'redirect' from the/a first FileSender landing page to the 'New Upload' page so that when people do use the Back button they go back to a FileSender page and not a SSP page ? FYI: at SURFnet I almost get no support questions (it does seem to work without questions for most people) except for the occasional error report about this one. Jan also got them at UNINETT. My standard reply ("Don't use the Back button") somehow doesn't feel good ;-) It does happen in 1.0/1,1 but also in 1.5 if you never leave the New Upload page.

summary: Problematic downloads using Chrome on Windows7-before-SP1
description:
As discovered and reported by Xander Jansen:

Downloads using Chrome on Win7 *without SP1 or the relevant hotfix* are seemingly OK (no error message) but are incomplete (way too small). Applying a MS Hotfix *or* updating to Win7 SP1 appears to fix the problem. 

Even then there is the issue that Win7 still seems to be silent about filled disks :( 

Another strange thing is that the Win7 Resource Monitor seems to have a problem measuring the network load when uploading with Chrome. It reports something like 500Kbps when the actual
upload performance was more like 30 Mbps or more.


The bug is more or less mentioned/described in http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=21055 (comments 56 and 57 are relevant). 
Relevant link to Microsoft knowledge base: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2498472

This is NOT a bug in FileSender hence not something we can fix but it *is* an issue that will affect the FileSender user experience and therefore is documented here.

summary: HTML5 (or Gears) upload with a backslash or double quote in the filename fails
description:
With 1.1 using HTML5 and also with 1.0.1 using Gears uploads of a file containg a \ in the filename fails after upload. User gets a 'Cannot move file' popup and on the backend a "Cannot find File in Temp Folder" is logged in the administrator Error logs (accesible from the UI).

This is caused by the way the filename is passed on to the backend on two different
occasions in two different ways. 

During the upload (of each chunk) the filename is passed through a POST/GET and the \ gets escaped (say hi to the magic quotes :():

    [n] => back\\slash.jpg

After the upload when the file is moved from temp storage to final storage the filename is sent in a json-encoded block and the \ is not escaped:

   [fileoriginalname] => back\slash.jpg

Since the filename is used for generating a hashed temporary filename on the backend there will be a *different* tempfilename on both occasions and the move will fail.

A structural solution would be to use the same method on both occasions to pass the filename from UI to backend (so any escaping/encoding/etc will be the same) or use one moment in the workflow to generate the tempfilename and use the result on all occasions where the tempfilename is needed.

Workarounds for this case could be:

- put the \ on the list of invalid characters in the filename (function fnCheckString in the flex source in two src files) Needs careful checking on Windows where the \ has a special meaning.
- use stripslashes on the input during uploads: this might work but is highly dependent on the 'magic quotes' mess we all learned to love and will definitely introduce complications
- turn of magic quotes ? (needs testing and sanity checking)

Note that this will be taken care of in 1.5 in a structural way, see #405

Note that it is possible to upload files with a " in the name with Flash. See also #601 .

summary: Improve download usability: direct download link + correct mime-type?
description:
When a recipient clicks on the download link, a web page opens with info and a big download button.  The original motivation for doing it this way was practical: we couldn't do direct downloads with the technology choices we'd made.  However, this reason is no longer there.

In addition, back in the filesender prototyping days in 2008, I remember reasoning that a user ought to have both options: a direct download-link in the email, clicking on which resulted in the file downloading (and possibly opening in the right application), with in additoin a "click here to learn more about your file before downloading it" anti-phishing link.

We ended up with *only* the anti-phishing option, out of necessity.  Now that it is no longer needed, we should revisit this and make it easier.

This ties in with a request I've seen for a "direct download link" to allow tools like wget, curl to download a file directly (automating workflow!).  Another good reason to do this is complaints I got from a number of users: the click on the link but the file doesn't open in <relevant app>.  So there is a group of users to whom it is more natural to click and see the file open.  I suggest we make this happen.

It probably involves some fiddling with sending the right  mime-type as well I'd guess.

Real time upload/download performance feedback
description:
Jeff Hagley, setting up the Internet2 FileSender install, came with this feature request.

Implement real time feedback to the user through the UI on upload/download performance and feedback on that performance relative to what others get.

If we can tell a user "the average person got 80Mbps upload and 83 Mbps download, and here is what you just got/are getting" that would help both the user and
the site.

The user has the benefit of knowing whether he's within the reasonable upload/downloadspeed band or whether there is something that might need attention.

The site has the benefit of both marketing a high speed high quality network "upload through your NREN and life is good", and enabling a user to figure out
whether the problem is their bandwidth/desktop or whether there might be a service issue.


Blue sky dream: something a-la SURFnet-Detective for FileSender specific. Give users real time feedback on upload/download performance, and on said performance
compared to other users.  In addition, allow them to do a pre-upload check on performance.  AdobeConnect does this, as do many DDoS clients.  That pre-upload
check might then include other checks, a sort of "can I do FileSender and how fast can I do it" check.  Lastly would be great to include some way to help users
diagnose possible problems.

Now this looks remarkably like the SURFnet detective but then FileSender specific.

It would require stuff in the UI.  Where we'd put it is probably clear when we've sorted out the "where do we put advanced functionality without cluttering the
basic functionality" question.  In addition there is backend code that needs to be written.

Jeff suggested this could work with PerfSonar.

summary: provide opt-in mechanism to notify of imminent file expiry
description:
It might be useful to provide users with an unobtrusive per-file-opt-in mechanism that (provided they opt in) would provide them with notification of imminent expiry of a file -- they could use this notification event to take actions such as ringing their intended recipients in a last-ditch effort to get them to download the soon-to-be-no-longer-available file, or re-upload a new file or a replacement file.

Off the top of my head I could think of the attaching of an iCalendar TODO event along with the your-file-is-now-available email; users could decide for themselves whether to import the event in the iCalendar file into their personal calendars. Xander warns me that some groupware email clients (Zimbra?) automatically import such iCalendar files into their user calendars, without consulting the user.

More exotically, perhaps per-user-per-file RSS subscriptions are possible? Per-user tweets? Per-user facebook wall messages? Suggestions very welcome.

summary: Possible performance improvement: use persistent HTTP1.1 for file upload
description: HTTP 1.1 supports persistent http connections.  If we throw chunks over the same http connection rather than creating a new connection for each chunk we would save the tcp window size negotiated and that might improve upload performance on longer latency links.  Note that we *might* already be doing this, I'm just not sure.

In 1.1, the HTML5 logo *is* displayed on the logon page. Note that this is most annoying when using a language where the "_HTML5Supported" language tag is a bit longer (all languages except English ;-). Workaround is to insert a
in the _HTML5Supported tag but a more structural way (if possible) might be nice. Note that this can be postponed to after 1.5 if it is too complex.

summary: Add Italian language files
Restructure naming of language files
description:
Current naming scheme of the language files deviates from Best Current Practices (as defined by BCP 47 and related ICU/ISO guidelines). Main deviation being the use of lower/upper case of language and country tags. To prevent confusion we should go to the following filename naming scheme:

<language>_<COUNTRY>

<language> is the shortest two/three letter ISO 639 language code in lowercase
<COUNTRY> (or better perhaps <REGION>) is the ISO 3166-1 country/region/territory code in UPPERcase

Use of "_" (underscore) in filenames follows the convention for defining 'locales' on modern Linux/Unix systems (and defined/allowd by the related Unicode/ICU definitions, see [[url:http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unicode_Language_and_Locale_Identifiers|http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unicode_Language_and_Locale_Identifiers]] )

Note that browser tags for language preference use the "-" hyphen (as defined in BCP 47)

Changing this in beta2 has two advantages:
1) use of well used standard for naming locales (for filenames).
2) no mix-up with 'old-style' language definitions in ./config (see related ticket #657)

Re 2) Since we decided to move the distribution provided './config' language definitions to the main files in ./language', left-overs in '/.config' should not be used anymore unless they cotain local modifications. A side effect of renaming all language files now will be that the 'left-overs' in './config' won't be used anymore so the actual (and possibly changed) definitions in the './language' dir will always be used. pre-beta2 users can be directed to move local customisations (and only those) to a file according to the 'new' scheme.

summary: possible performance improvement in www/fs_upload.php
description:
Not so much a bug, but something that is very related to 1.5

Chris and I were discussing upload speed for chunked (html5) upload and where there might be options for improvement.  I looked at http 1.1 keep_alive this week and didn't really see a difference in with or without.  Chris suggested to look at the bit where the chunks are actually written to the temp file.
Around line 247 in www/fs_upload.php there's this code:

while( $data = fread( $fd,  1000000  ) ) file_put_contents( $config["site_filestore"].sanitizeFilename($tempFilename).checkFileSize($uploadfolder.$tempFilename)."tmp", $data ) or die("Error");
 
It effectively "chunks the chunk".  It looked like changing that line to:

file_put_contents( $config["site_filestore"].sanitizeFilename($tempFilename), $fd, FILE_APPEND ) or die("Error");

made for an interesting performance difference.  Chris will look at whether there was a good reason to use the while loop.

summary: Logon possible with javascript disabled

This application will not run without Javascript enabled in your web browser." is displayed, the logon link (label, not the button) is still displayed and the user can still logon. This was pointed out by the Monash University User Experience review, which suggested "Not allowing users to log-in if they do not have JavaScript turned on [...]". They also pointed out that the warning message is difficult to read (black text on grey background). (After logon, the javascript warning message is also displayed, and the browse button is not available, so the user cannot upload a file).

summary: Automate email interaction
description: Automate interaction with emails, including selecting the relevant email, verifying subject and key contents of message, and "clicking" on url to file / voucher

summary: Dragging of button images possible instead of clicking
description: If one points to many of the buttons (e.g. Logon and those across the top of the page) and holds down the left mouse button without then releasing it straight away (i.e. without clicking), it is possible to drag around a ghost of the button. Can this be prevented? When the mouse button is released, the button returns to its place but it doesn't activate.

description: Now that test suites are in place, common variables can be placed in a single file which can then be called by each test suite. This should remove the need to update variables such as expiry dates across multiple scripts. Sample set of variable settings provided by Xander :).

summary: Links to wiki in Help and About load within FileSender tab
description: When clicking on the www.filesender.org in Help and About, the wiki loads in the FileSender tab behind the Help or About popup. All other links in Help open in a new tab, which is preferable.

description: Current scripts created using Selenium-IDE work using the -htmlSuite option of Selenium Server (Selenium-RC), with Firefox (*firefox) and IE (*iexplore) (see #686). However this is not working with Google Chrome (*googlechrome), which requires further investigation.

summary: Incorrect on-screen notification for automatically deleted file
description: When a recipient tries clicking on the url to a manually deleted file, the on-screen message correctly reads "This file has been deleted. ", however if the file was deleted automatically it reads "This voucher has already been used.". I suggest that both messages should read "This file has been deleted. ". See related ticket #649.

summary: Explore expiry date calculation based on displayed date
description: Investigate whether different kinds of expiry dates (e.g. tomorrow, configured maximum) can be calculated by Selenium (as suggested by Xander), from the information already provided in the GUI. It is possible to calculate some parameters with Selenium using 'storeEval'. See Selenium documentation sections [[url:http://seleniumhq.org/docs/02_selenium_ide.html#store-commands-and-selenium-variables|Store Commands and Selenium Variables]], [[url:http://seleniumhq.org/docs/02_selenium_ide.html#javascript-and-selenese-parameters|JavaScript and Selenese Parameters]] and [[url:http://seleniumhq.org/docs/02_selenium_ide.html#echo-the-selenese-print-command|echo - The Selenese Print Command]].

summary: Incorrect on-screen message for automatically deleted voucher
description: When trying to access an unused voucher that has been automatically deleted, the on-screen message reads "This voucher has already been used.". I think this should probably read something like "This voucher has been cancelled" (as per when trying to use a voucher that has been cancelled by the issuer) or even better "This voucher has expired". (Fore reference, the message when trying to use a voucher that already has been used is "This voucher has already been used."). See related ticket #646.

summary: Upload recipient maximum and syntax check timing
description: When uploading a file as an authenticated user or using a voucher, the check for maximum recipients and email syntax used to be at the time of entering email addresses, which worked well, but now this is delayed until the user clicks on submit.

summary: 'Pending' database record contains all recipients in 'fileto' which breaks when the number of characters exceeds 250
description: It looks like when uploading a file destined for more than 1 recipient creates a Pending db-entry containing all the recipients in the 'fileto' column. This might break when the number of recipients is large enough to exceed the 250 character limit of the fileto column.

summary: Progress bar starts at 0% before jumping to actual % when resuming upload
description: When resuming an upload (HTML5), the progress bar initially starts at 0%, then jumps to whatever % the previous upload attempt started at. This is disconcerting and could cause a user to unneccesarily abort a resumed upload, thinking that it is starting over. Tested on Mac OSX 10.6.8 with Firefox 11.0 (Flash 11.2.202.228).

summary: My FIles listing out of order when adding multiple recipients
description: When adding multiple recipients to an existing file, the order of the resulting file listings is unexpected, with the two entries in separate parts of the table rather than together above the original file entry or at the top of the list.

summary: Momentary white page during page reload (IE9?)
description: Sometimes when the page reloads, such as switching from the "Send File" to "Guest Voucher" page, or displaying "Voucher Sent" after issuing a voucher, the page flashes white momentarily when using IE 9.0.4 on Windows 7. This does not seem to be a Flash-only issue as it does not occur using Safari 5.0.5 on Mac OSX 10.6.8. This also does not occur using Firefox 11.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8. Flash 11.2.202.228 used in all cases.

summary: Direct download from My Files table fails with IE9
description: Downloading a file directly from the "My Files" table fails with IE 9.0.4 on Windows 7. The page flashes white and returns to "My Files". On Mac OSX 10.6.8 with Safari 5.0.5 a blank untitled browser tab opens but the file does still download, while with Firefox 11.0 the file downloads 'normally'. Flash 11.2.202.228 used in all cases.

summary: Displayimage caching control
description:
Quotng Thijs: "Here's a small patch for cache control in displayimage.php. In my server logs 
I see that every click in the FileSender interface yields two requests, one 
for the page, one for displayimage. This image can however easily be cached by 
the browser as it will hardly change.

Attached patch allows caching of the image and handles conditional get (304). 
It also touches some other lines with whitespace changes as the original 
intentation was a bit mixed up."

summary: No bcc email for manual file deletion when voucher issuer was not a file recipient
description: When a voucher recipient uses a voucher to upload a file to share with someone other than the voucher issuer, if the voucher issuer deletes the file from the "My Files" table the voucher issuer does not receive a bcc email notification (but the file recipients do). This may be by design and regardless does make some sense.

summary: Add option to secure wipe files in cron.php
description:
Suggested feature contributed by Tilburg University/Thijs:

"> Within our organisation there was the desire that files get not simply
> > unlinked when they are expired but are wiped from disk by overwriting them
> > with random data. This tries to combat the effect of filesender's filestore
> > becoming a goldmine of assorted documents that would be easy to recover -
> > somewhat like the infamous printer hard drives.
> > 
> > Attached patch implements this. 

As discussed with Xander, here's an updated version of the patch that makes 
the shred command configurable as well."

summary: Make 'direct downloads' easier
description:
Suggested feature from Tilburg University/Thijs to make non-UI-based downloads (with wget/curl/fetch) easier.

Alternatives could be to include a link in the email and download-page to the direct-download. To be decided/reviewed in the beta3 cycle.

"We received as user feedback that they want to have an URL from filesender 
that they can use to download the file on the command line (with wget or curl 
for example).

The 'user story' is that the user is working on an ADSL link from home. He 
receives an ISO via filesender from which he wants to boot a virtual machine. 
With current filesender the user is not provided with an URL to download the 
ISO directly, only one that works with JavaScript only. He wants to be able to 
have an URL that he can feed to wget to download the ISO straight to the right 
server, not first download to his workstation only to upload it again to the 
server over ADSL.

It can be assumed that in many cases where receiving huge files, you want to 
use them in a context which is not your local workstation.

The fix turned out rather simple: the Start Download button uses JavaScript 
document.location to start the download. However, there's no need for this 
(anymore). Therefore, I've moved the download URL from the JavaScript into the 
href attribute. The onClick remains to display the informational message. 
Users that know how to use wget will know how to right-click on the Start 
Download button and copy the URL that they need."

summary: FileSender version is displayed twice
description:
Quoting Thijs:

"the filesender version number is displayed twice: both at
the top-right and bottom of the page; the second one is not influenced by
the 'versionNumber' setting from config.php, so I've removed that one
altogether."

Propose to do this for all actual releases but not on the development branches/trunk. Or we could move the second display to a HTML commented part in the output (on the assumption that the second one in the footer is meant to always have some indication on the version running for debug-purposes). I also think we should keep the footer <div> (can be empty).

As Wendy noticed: Looking at the tab titles, I noticed that while loading etc. the title can

upload page reloads after cancelling a Flash upload, the tab title changes
to "FileSender#" "

summary: Empty Guest Voucher table text
description: When the "My Files" table is empty the text "There are currently no files available" is displayed beneath the table headings. It could be nice to display some equivalent text when the "Guest Voucher" table is empty. Note that in 1.1 the subheading "Current Valid Vouchers" was included above the voucher table, but this doesn't really seem necessary together with the main heading. So perhaps a message when the voucher table is empty could be "There are currently no valid vouchers"? Otherwise "There are currently no vouchers available".

summary: Facilitate feedback-points in warnings/errors
description:
SimpleSamlphp throws up a feedback form whenever something "really bad" happens.  The ease of reporting critical errors makes people actually report those.  FileSender should have something like that.  For example when a "$lang["_DISK_SPACE_ERROR"]" is thrown, that a pointer to the instances standard problem reporting mechanisms is included.  Or even better: a standard form.  Something like that.  

This feature suggestion is to comb through the language file and identify logical points where to do that.  Second stage is to implement a practical way to make user feedback easy but only when you as service admin *really* want it: when stuf unexpectedly has gone wrong.  Maybe a standard feedback form or something.

Having some logic sort options in the MyFiles table might be helpful in general.  Note that also "how to display "multiple file uploads" will be an interesting one.

Thunderbird 13 offers the possiblitiy to use Filelink Services like yousendit.

http://filesender.uservoice.com/forums/56700-filesender-feature-request-forum

summary: Upload using voucher rejects valid email address

summary: Authenticated upload after failed attempt using voucher in another tab cancels voucher and displays Guest upload confirmation
description:
If I try to upload a file using a voucher and this fails (e.g. case in #721) and I then load the "Send File" page as an authenticated user and upload a file:
* the upload confirmation page presented is that for a Guest (no "Send File", "Guest Voucher" or "My Files" buttons are displayed) but should be the one for an authenticated user
* the voucher I had been trying to use is cancelled (can no longer be used, disappears from Vouchers table) 
* the uploaded file does still reflect an authenticated upload in the "My Files" table, in that the sender is "Me"

summary: Authenticated Flash upload displays Guest upload confirmation
description: After an authenticated upload using Flash, the upload confirmation page presented is that for a Guest (no "Send File", "Guest Voucher" or "My Files" of "Logoff" buttons are displayed) but should be the one for an authenticated user, although the upload is still recorded in the "My Files" table as sent from "Me" - tested using IE9 on Windows7 (VM) and Safari 5.0.5 on Mac OSX 10.6.8, both with Flash 11.2.202.233. The correct confirmation page is still displayed for authenticated uploads with HTML5 - tested with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8. As at r.1416. May be related to #722.

summary: When issuing voucher no "Voucher Sent" message and page does not refresh
description: When issuing a Guest Voucher, after clicking on "Send Voucher" the message "Voucher Sent" does not appear and the page does not refresh, although the voucher has been issued and emails generated. This leaves the recipient email address still in the "Send Vouchers to:" field, the expiry date as the date selected by the user (if applicable) and the new voucher is not displayed in the table. However if the page is refreshed by the user, the fields reset and the issued voucher appears in the table. Note that if one clicks on the "Send Voucher" button a second time before manually refreshing the page, a second voucher will also be issued (and listed in the table when manually refreshed).

summary: HTML5(Not)Supported tooltip shows raw html code in language tags
Cancel / pause upload using voucher displays authenticated upload page and then rejects valid email address
description: When the page is refreshed after pausing an HTML5 or Flash upload using a voucher, the url of the refreshed page ends in /index.php?s=upload#. If I am also logged on in another tab, the refreshed page displays "Welcome [...]" and all action buttons, while if I am not already logged on the refreshed page presents the Logon page. If I then try to continue (in the case where I am also logged on in another tab) by restarting or resuming the upload, after clicking on "Send" the valid email address which had been accepted for the initial upload is rejected "Invalid or missing email". Note that if I click on the "Back" button in the browser, it takes me to the url for the voucher with "#" at the end (with "Welcome Guest" and only the "Help", "About" and "Logon" buttons displayed in the header), then if I go back further I reach the initial voucher upload page. Seen using FF 12.0 and Safari 5.0.5 on Mac OSX with Flash 11.2.202.233.

summary: Download page formatting
description: On the Download page, the message contents text is centred with a green background (whether populated or blank) , in the style of the "Your file has been uploaded and message sent." etc. on-screen message(s). This content should be left-aligned without a background, as per other contents on this page. Also the "Start Download" button is now small and left-centred.

summary: Design of email-workflow
description: See #704 and #698. As Chris remarked: "this is important to workflow changes that will happen when we do multiple file upload." In general, who gets mail when.

summary: Email validity check logic when issuing voucher
description: When issuing a voucher, if one enters an invalid email address the "Invalid or missing email" warning appears, however subsequently entering a valid email address does not clear the warning (but does when uploading a file) until after one clicks on the "Send Voucher" button. (To note only: if one does not enter an email address at all, the warning correctly (as discussed in #695) does not appear until after clicking on "Send (Voucher)" in both workflows).

summary: Conduct 1.5-beta3 client-side workflow tests
description: Once 1.5-beta3 code is considered ready for testing and preview installation has been updated accordingly, conduct semi-automated 1.5-beta3 client-side workflow tests as outlined at [[Test Workflows for v1-5]], updating descriptions of manual steps where applicable.

summary: Two links in Help direct to top of Help page with IE9 9 after logon (but not before logon)
description: In the "Help" popup, all links open in new tabs before and after logon with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX and IE9 on Windows7 (Flash 11.2.202.235). After logon, all links also redirect with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX, however the "Adobe Flash" and "www.filesender.org" links direct back to the top of the "Help" popup with IE9 on Windows7 (Flash 11.2.202.235).

summary: "amp;" part of "& amp;" not preserved in subject of email with IE9 on Windows7
description: The "amp;" part of "& amp;" is not being preserved in the subject of emails when uploaded (authenticated or using voucher) with IE9 on Windows7 (Flash 11.2.202.235), but is being preserved in the message inside the email as well as in the subject and message fields of both the "My Files" table and the "Download" page. It is also preserved in all of these cases (subject and message of email as well as the subject and message fields of both the "My Files" table and the "Download" page) when uploaded (authenticated or using voucher) with FF 12.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8 (no Flash).

summary: Inconsistent AUP box check (or not) after pausing / cancelling upload
description: After pausing (HTML5) or cancelling (Flash) an authenticated upload the AUP box remains checked. However for an upload using a voucher (in both the HTML5 and Flash cases) the AUP check box is reset to unchecked. Resetting to unchecked may be better, as the user has not completed the upload yet and would be in keeping with the fact that all other fields on the page already reset. Note also that if I cancel an upload using a voucher (while unauthenticated), then logon, the AUP box is checked in the authenticated tab.

summary: Feature request: On Logon page make separate text for pageheading and logon button
description:
Currently the Logon page has one textstring defined which is used for both the page heading and the logon button: lang("_LOGON")

Making a separate definition for the pageheading gives more flexibility.

summary: Feature request: use $config['site_name'] in _SITE_SPLASHTEXT (and similar)
description:
Currently the _SITE_SPLASH_TEXT on the landing page uses the fixes "FileSender" name. We could (just as in _ABOUT_TEXT) replace that with the site_name variable.

Indirectly suggested by Guido.

summary: Review current recommended PHP settings in documentation and sample ini file
description:
Current documentation states: 
To allow for larger files and longer execution times you will need to edit these lines:

max_input_time(in seconds)
upload_max_filesize(in M)
post_max_size (in M)

NOTE: Remember to change filesender $config['max_flash_upload_size'] to match your upload_max_filesize.If they are not the same FileSender will use the lowest value as the actual maximum upload size for Flash uploads.

Reasonable values are:

max_input_time = 3600
upload_max_filesize = 2047M
post_max_size = 2146445312 ; 2047M + 10K
These settings are as is distributed in the config-templates/filesender-php.ini file. In practice this restricts Flash-uploads to 2047MB (base 1024) which is slightly less than the 2GB limit (base 1024) advertised in the help (note: the limit in the help text is the 2047M value rounded to the nearest GB) which is confusing in case a file larger than 2047MB but smaller than 2GB is tried but refused). We might want to review these recommended settings (why is it set to 2047MB? Is this still needed? etc...)

summary: Use of alternating colors in MyFiles table
description: The table rows in My Files have alternating colors but when there is more than 1 file available the first two rows have the same color and the alternating color only starts in the third row. In the Vouchers table this 'skipping of the first row' is not happening. The fix in [[r:1501]] makes the alternating consistent between the two pages *but* when the MyFiles table is empty the message "There are currently no files available' is 'gray' but only for the first 7 columns, leaving a 'white' block for the remainder of the row. On the Vouchre page the row with "There are currently no vouchers available" is completely 'white' (no alternative coloring). This very minor detail could probably be fixed in beta4.

summary: Language tag comparison broken for less preferred languages
description:
When comparing browser language tags with defined languages 'weighted' tags won't work because the weight isn't stripped from the tag. This happens when the most preferred browser language is *not* defined for filesender but one of the lesse preferred browser language is. For example:

    [0] => af
    [1] => nl;q=0.9
    [2] => en-us;q=0.8
    [3] => en;q=0.7
    [4] => de;q=0.6
    [5] => it-ch;q=0.5
    [6] => no;q=0.5
    [7] => nb;q=0.4
    [8] => sl;q=0.3
    [9] => it;q=0.2

summary: Security audit: 2.2.1: store all temporary, user-uploaded and php “include” files outside the document root
description: As far as we can tell this is already the case and the documentation seems correct.  Xander will clarify with security auditor where the exact issue is.

summary: Security audit 2.10.1: Require users to solve a CAPTCHA when they send many files
description:
Xander: "Advice doesn't take into account that FileSender should be regarded as a
MUA, all use of FS is authenticated and is not different from using a
normal MUA. Just as with a normal MUA the user has indeed the ability to
spam. The risk of blacklisting can be mitigated with a configurable
max-recipient limit in FS or outside of FS on the sending MTA with
standard rate-limiting measures.

Using CAPTCHA's or comparable is nice for a simple webform where you can
get to without real authentication but this item from the checklist just
does not apply to FileSender."

note Jan: irrelevant because FileSender has *authenticated* users, and adding captcha adds inconvenience for users.

summary: Security audit: 2.11.3: Use the session_regenerate_id() function after switching to a SSL connection.
description:
Xander: "Currently session_destroy() is used which clears all session variables
*except* the PHPSESSID. The PHPSESSID cookie *should* be reset with the
setcookie(session_name(),'') call but after investigation it appears
that that does not work (anymore?) as intended. However adding a expiry
time in the past and the 'path' to the setcookie call fixes that and
forces the client to delete the 'compromised' cookie after which a new
session cookie is generated on the SSL-connection. Non-committed patch
is running on proto"

Security auditors suggestion "regenerate session id" is probably not the best solution, what we do (and should do) is to *remove*, destroying all variables on the unsecured session when you move to the secured session.  Patch is now commited, rv1556.

Fix will not be applied to 1.1.1.

summary: Security audit: 2.11.4: Set the secure flag on the session cookie using session_set_cookie_params().
description:
"The cookies that hold the session id have to be secured with certain flags. The secure flag instructs the browser to only send a cookie over HTTPS requests. This helps to prevent interception of the session id."

This is a recommendation for PHP-setup (in the supplied php.ini sample
config file) and left to the administrator to enforce or not depending
on the setup. Suggested feature for after 1.5 (configurable like in
SSP). Was already a known issue and candidate for hardening document.


; If your FileSender is only available over https (which it should be), enable
; the following to have secure session cookies
;
; session.cookie_secure = On
; session.cookie_httponly = On

See also ticket #758

For longer term, this would better be enforced by FileSender to prevent "shoot yourself in the foot".  SimpleSAMLphp has this, and could possibly be copied.

summary: Security audit 2.11.2: Use the session_regenerate_id function when the user logs in to prevent session fixation.
description:
Recommendation: At moment of login, re-initialise all variables including php_sessionId to prevent session fixation.

Impact score in audit is low, not deemed directly dangerous for now.  This requires more research and impact analysis, to be done post.1.5 release.

summary: Security audit 2.11.5: Set the httponly flag on the session cookie using session_set_cookie_params().
description:
Is recommendation for PHP-setup. Suggested feature for after 1.5
(configurable like in SSP). See also 2.11.4.  (#759)

summary: Security audit: 2.6.2: Add an access check to the admin page
description: During discussion it was unclear exactly why this would be an issue.  Xander to clarify with Pine Security.

summary: Security audit: 2.7.2: Change sanitizeFilename to filter out all bad characters
description:
From the report:

"Issue:
When the user can specify a filename, the application has to check if the filename does not contain unexpected values. For example, allowing a filename like ../file can lead to a "path traversal" problem.

Result:
The Filesender application properly encodes user input before it is used within filenames. The following function could be improved, since it only replaces the first dot with an underscore, but all user input is hashed with md5 and therefore safe. This checklist item is marked as “Passed”."

Deferred because not currently an issue.  For after 1.5: need to make a decision, either drop the function (in practice we use the hash where it matters) or fix it to prevent issues should we ever use the function for anything else.  Client-side the browsers protect users against malicious-filenames-on-download.

summary: remove logtime from database scripts
description:
Well-spotted by Vegard Polden.

We have a field "logtime" that is not used.  It is only present in the database scripts:

scripts/filesender_db.sql:  logtime time with time zone,
scripts/mysql_filesender_db.sql:  `logtime` time DEFAULT NULL,

Chris replies that this is deprecated.  We one time planned to use separate fields for date and time but ended up using one field for both.  So we have to get rid of that field.

-remove the field from both database scripts
-add to upgrade notes some database command to remove that deprecated field from existing databases

All of course pending X acknowledge

summary: Security audit 2.7.6: prevent shoot-in-foot, harden more by also sanitising output not user-generated
description:
So far we made sure output that was the result of user input got sanitised.  A recommendation in the May 2012 security audit is to apply output sanitisation to *all* possible output, making FileSender more hardened against unexpected consequences of changing language files, config files etc. and hardening better against unexpected avenues of attack.

This requires a systematic effort to go through *all* output generating functionality and:

-check whether output sanitisation is done
-if not done, apply output sanitisation
-verify that the most optimal output sanitisation function is applied for that particular context (place in workflow, point in time)

Unexpected behaviour when clicking on Send multiple times during upload
description:
When 'clicking' (manually or using a script) on the "Send" button multiple times (prior to or after the progress bar appears) during an upload, the following has been observed (HTML5 case with Firefox 15.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8). Xander suggests that this may be a symptom of #641 / #663.
1. *Clicking again prior to progress bar appearing (authenticated):*  progress bar at multiples of 100% (e.g. 200%, 300% etc), with a horizontal scrollbar (because the progress bar extends beyond the 100%), otherwise as expected.
2. *Clicking again prior to progress bar appearing (using voucher):* progress bar at multiples of 100% (as above) plus one of the following. The file did not appear in the "My Files" table, and no emails were generated to advise that the file had been uploaded. However the voucher could no longer be used and vanished from the "Guest Voucher" table.
- either an error at the top of the page with a green background "Error accessing server", or
- a popup "You are no longer authenticated. Your session may have expired or there has been a server error. Please logon again and re-try.". After clicking on OK / the close symbol, the page loaded "This voucher has already been used.". Automatically logged off.
3. *Clicking again after progress bar appearing (authenticated):* each time I clicked on "Send" (after the initial click) the error "Invalid or missing email" kept appearing under the recipient email address. *The "Welcome Guest" page appeared (which should have been "Welcome [first name surname]"* with "Your file has been uploaded and message sent.". Otherwise as expected.
4. *Clicking again after progress bar appearing (authenticated):* as per 3., but *voucher was not deleted after use*.

summary: Check logEntry() calls and add E_ERROR parameter where appropriate
description: so that real errors are also logged when debug is false. Note that on most places it already is done.

summary: Guest voucher is marked as used even when an upload error occurs
description: When using a guest voucher and some error occurs on the server after uploading a file the voucher is still marked as used. See the sequence in www/fs_upload.php in the "uploadcomplete" case. Can we safely  move the 'close voucher' block to after the error checking without breaking something ?

summary: Move AuthSaml->sAuth logging to logEntry mechanism
description: With debug set to false most informational logging is suppressed. However there is still excessive logging of the AuthSAML->sAuth call which logs the user attributes and some other details on almost every action. By moving this to the logEntry() mechanism with a standard E_NOTICE or E_ERROR in case of a problem this will reduce the debug=false logging to errors only.

summary: "Invalid or missing email" warning does not clear when cancelling Adding New Recipient
description: If the warning "Invalid or missing email" is triggered when adding a new recipient, and then adding the new recipient is cancelled, when clicking on the "Add New Recipient" button again next to *any* file in the "My Files" table the warning is still there. This may be related to #605 and #794.

summary: Upload continues with hidden progress bar when hitting Esc instead of clicking on Cancel or Yes
description: When trying to cancel an upload, whether authenticated or using a voucher, if I hit the esc key on my keyboard instead of clicking on the "Cancel" button, or I click on "Cancel" and then hit Esc instead of clicking on "Yes" or "No", the progress bar popup vanishes, upload fields do not reset but instead become active and editable (not greyed over) and the upload completes ("Your file has been uploaded and message sent", file is listed in "My Files", emails are generated and file can be downloaded). Clicking on "My Files" or "Guest Voucher" after hitting esc does seem to terminate the upload though. Could hitting Esc be an equivalent of clicking on an "X" in the corner of a popup to close it (even though the progress bar popup doesn't have an "X" visible)?

summary: Clicking on Send multiple times when adding new recipient issues multiples
description: If the "Send" button is clicked on multiple times when adding new recipient(s), multiple unique (i.e. different url for each) entries in "My Files" and corresponding emails are generated. Observed with Firefox 15.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8.

summary: Clicking on Send Voucher multiple times issues multiples
description: If the "Send Voucher" button is clicked on multiple times, multiple unique (i.e. different url for each) vouchers and corresponding emails are generated. A message with a green background on the "Guest Vouchers" page "Error accessing server" also appears momentarily. Observed with Firefox 15.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8.

summary: Remove dependency on php-gmp by simplifying IPv6 check
description: As suggested (with contributed patch) by Thijs the dependency on php-gmp can be removed by changing/simplifying the chekIp6() function. Can be done with inet_pton() or with the filter_var($ip, FILTER_VALIDATE_IP, FILTER_FLAG_IPV6) function.

summary: A normal Flash upload cancel generates E_ERROR (file NOT moved)
description: When canceling a Flash upload the temporary file on the server is not available/removed (standard PHP mechanism) and move_uploaded_file() will return FALSE. This is always (regardless of reason) logged on the server as an ERROR in www/fs_upload.php although in this case (and possibly others) it is normal behaviour. This might be improved by looking at the specific reason (see http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.file-upload.errors.php ). For now left as a known issue.

summary: Errors after pausing authenticated upload followed by pausing upload using voucher
description:
If I pause an authenticated upload, then pause an upload of the same file using a voucher, and then:
* try to resume the authenticated upload of the same file (whether I logged off before starting the upload using the voucher or not), I receive the warning "Invalid or missing email" for a valid email address
* log off and try to resume the upload of the same file using the voucher, I get a popup "Message. There has been an error - please contact your administrator".
Observed with Firefox 15.0 on Mac OSX 10.6.8.
